intro: Athrixia subsimplex, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and are typically greenish-white in color. Athrixia subsimplex thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
